snippet: The measures, which will take effect on Friday, are meant to punish the country for its role in promoting separatist warfare in eastern Ukraine, officials said.
abstract: United States and Europe agree to place additional economic sanctions on Russia over its role in Ukraine despite new cease-fire agreement.

byline.original: By JAMES KANTER and DAVID M. HERSZENHORN
byline.contributor: James Kanter reported from Brussels, and David M. Herszenhorn from Moscow. Peter Baker contributed reporting from Washington, and Andrew Roth from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: The measures, which will take effect on Friday, are meant to punish the country for its role in promoting separatist warfare in eastern Ukraine, officials said.

headline.main: U.S. and Europe Back New Economic Sanctions Against Russia
headline.print_headline: U.S. and Europe Back New Economic Sanctions Against Russia
